      • isAllowMultipleRegistrations

        public boolean isAllowMultipleRegistrations()
        Normally if a registered customer exists, we don't allow that customer to checkout without logging in. If allowMultipleRegistrations is set to true when calling forceRegisterCustomer(), then we do allow a registered customer to checkout without logging in by registering the same eMail address also as a temporary customer. Note that since a temporary customer is created for the checkout, the order is not added to the account of the existing registered customer with the same email address.
        Specified by:
        isAllowMultipleRegistrations in interface CustomerRegistrationIf
        Returns:
        the allowMultipleRegistrations

      • setAllowMultipleRegistrations

        public void setAllowMultipleRegistrations(boolean allowMultipleRegistrations)
        Normally if a registered customer exists, we don't allow that customer to checkout without logging in. If allowMultipleRegistrations is set to true when calling forceRegisterCustomer(), then we do allow a registered customer to checkout without logging in by registering the same eMail address also as a temporary customer. Note that since a temporary customer is created for the checkout, the order is not added to the account of the existing registered customer with the same email address.
        Specified by:
        setAllowMultipleRegistrations in interface CustomerRegistrationIf
        Parameters:
        allowMultipleRegistrations - the allowMultipleRegistrations to set
